intro: Leptophyllochloa micrathera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf grass, is a species of grass native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are small, cylindrical flower clusters. The botanical features of Leptophyllochloa micrathera make it adaptable to various environmental conditions, contributing to its ecological significance.
